connector.description: Sending and receive messages to/from AWS SQS service using AWS SDK version 2.x.

camel.source.endpoint.amazonAWSHost.name: camel.source.endpoint.amazonAWSHost
camel.source.endpoint.amazonAWSHost.description: The hostname of the Amazon AWS cloud.

camel.source.endpoint.amazonSQSClient.name: camel.source.endpoint.amazonSQSClient
camel.source.endpoint.amazonSQSClient.description: To use the AmazonSQS as client

camel.source.endpoint.autoCreateQueue.name: camel.source.endpoint.autoCreateQueue
camel.source.endpoint.autoCreateQueue.description: Setting the autocreation of the queue

camel.source.endpoint.headerFilterStrate.name: camel.source.endpoint.headerFilterStrategy
camel.source.endpoint.headerFilterStrate.description: To use a custom HeaderFilterStrategy to map headers to/from Camel.

camel.source.endpoint.overrideEndpoint.name: camel.source.endpoint.overrideEndpoint
camel.source.endpoint.overrideEndpoint.description: Set the need for overidding the endpoint. This option needs to be used in combination with uriEndpointOverride option

camel.source.endpoint.protocol.name: camel.source.endpoint.protocol
camel.source.endpoint.protocol.description: The underlying protocol used to communicate with SQS

camel.source.endpoint.proxyProtocol.name: camel.source.endpoint.proxyProtocol
camel.source.endpoint.proxyProtocol.description: To define a proxy protocol when instantiating the SQS client One of: [HTTP] [HTTPS]

camel.source.endpoint.queueOwnerAWSAccou.name: camel.source.endpoint.queueOwnerAWSAccountId
camel.source.endpoint.queueOwnerAWSAccou.description: Specify the queue owner aws account id when you need to connect the queue with different account owner.

camel.source.endpoint.region.name: camel.source.endpoint.region
camel.source.endpoint.region.description: The region in which SQS client needs to work. When using this parameter, the configuration will expect the lowercase name of the region (for example ap-east-1) You'll need to use the name Region.EU_WEST_1.id()

camel.source.endpoint.trustAllCertificat.name: camel.source.endpoint.trustAllCertificates
camel.source.endpoint.trustAllCertificat.description: If we want to trust all certificates in case of overriding the endpoint

camel.source.endpoint.uriEndpointOverrid.name: camel.source.endpoint.uriEndpointOverride
camel.source.endpoint.uriEndpointOverrid.description: Set the overriding uri endpoint. This option needs to be used in combination with overrideEndpoint option

camel.source.endpoint.useDefaultCredenti.name: camel.source.endpoint.useDefaultCredentialsProvider
camel.source.endpoint.useDefaultCredenti.description: Set whether the SQS client should expect to load credentials on an AWS infra instance or to expect static credentials to be passed in.

camel.source.endpoint.attributeNames.name: camel.source.endpoint.attributeNames
camel.source.endpoint.attributeNames.description: A list of attribute names to receive when consuming. Multiple names can be separated by comma.

camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler.name: camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler
camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.source.endpoint.concurrentConsumer.name: camel.source.endpoint.concurrentConsumers
camel.source.endpoint.concurrentConsumer.description: Allows you to use multiple threads to poll the sqs queue to increase throughput

camel.source.endpoint.deleteAfterRead.name: camel.source.endpoint.deleteAfterRead
camel.source.endpoint.deleteAfterRead.description: Delete message from SQS after it has been read

camel.source.endpoint.deleteIfFiltered.name: camel.source.endpoint.deleteIfFiltered
camel.source.endpoint.deleteIfFiltered.description: Whether or not to send the DeleteMessage to the SQS queue if the exchange has property with key Sqs2Constants#SQS_DELETE_FILTERED (CamelAwsSqsDeleteFiltered) set to true.

camel.source.endpoint.extendMessageVisib.name: camel.source.endpoint.extendMessageVisibility
camel.source.endpoint.extendMessageVisib.description: If enabled then a scheduled background task will keep extending the message visibility on SQS. This is needed if it takes a long time to process the message. If set to true defaultVisibilityTimeout must be set. See details at Amazon docs.

camel.source.endpoint.kmsDataKeyReusePer.name: camel.source.endpoint.kmsDataKeyReusePeriodSeconds
camel.source.endpoint.kmsDataKeyReusePer.description: The length of time, in seconds, for which Amazon SQS can reuse a data key to encrypt or decrypt messages before calling AWS KMS again. An integer representing seconds, between 60 seconds (1 minute) and 86,400 seconds (24 hours). Default: 300 (5 minutes).

camel.source.endpoint.kmsMasterKeyId.name: camel.source.endpoint.kmsMasterKeyId
camel.source.endpoint.kmsMasterKeyId.description: The ID of an AWS-managed customer master key (CMK) for Amazon SQS or a custom CMK.

camel.source.endpoint.maxMessagesPerPoll.name: camel.source.endpoint.maxMessagesPerPoll
camel.source.endpoint.maxMessagesPerPoll.description: Gets the maximum number of messages as a limit to poll at each polling. Is default unlimited, but use 0 or negative number to disable it as unlimited.

camel.source.endpoint.messageAttributeNa.name: camel.source.endpoint.messageAttributeNames
camel.source.endpoint.messageAttributeNa.description: A list of message attribute names to receive when consuming. Multiple names can be separated by comma.

camel.source.endpoint.sendEmptyMessageWh.name: camel.source.endpoint.sendEmptyMessageWhenIdle
camel.source.endpoint.sendEmptyMessageWh.description: If the polling consumer did not poll any files, you can enable this option to send an empty message (no body) instead.

camel.source.endpoint.serverSideEncrypti.name: camel.source.endpoint.serverSideEncryptionEnabled
camel.source.endpoint.serverSideEncrypti.description: Define if Server Side Encryption is enabled or not on the queue

camel.source.endpoint.visibilityTimeout.name: camel.source.endpoint.visibilityTimeout
camel.source.endpoint.visibilityTimeout.description: The duration (in seconds) that the received messages are hidden from subsequent retrieve requests after being retrieved by a ReceiveMessage request to set in the com.amazonaws.services.sqs.model.SetQueueAttributesRequest. This only make sense if its different from defaultVisibilityTimeout. It changes the queue visibility timeout attribute permanently.

camel.source.endpoint.waitTimeSeconds.name: camel.source.endpoint.waitTimeSeconds
camel.source.endpoint.waitTimeSeconds.description: Duration in seconds (0 to 20) that the ReceiveMessage action call will wait until a message is in the queue to include in the response.

camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler.name: camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler
camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this option is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern.name: camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern
camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern.description: Sets the exchange pattern when the consumer creates an exchange. One of: [InOnly] [InOut] [InOptionalOut]

camel.source.endpoint.pollStrategy.name: camel.source.endpoint.pollStrategy
camel.source.endpoint.pollStrategy.description: A pluggable org.apache.camel.PollingConsumerPollingStrategy allowing you to provide your custom implementation to control error handling usually occurred during the poll operation before an Exchange have been created and being routed in Camel.

camel.source.endpoint.delayQueue.name: camel.source.endpoint.delayQueue
camel.source.endpoint.delayQueue.description: Define if you want to apply delaySeconds option to the queue or on single messages

camel.source.endpoint.queueUrl.name: camel.source.endpoint.queueUrl
camel.source.endpoint.queueUrl.description: To define the queueUrl explicitly. All other parameters, which would influence the queueUrl, are ignored. This parameter is intended to be used, to connect to a mock implementation of SQS, for testing purposes.

camel.source.endpoint.proxyHost.name: camel.source.endpoint.proxyHost
camel.source.endpoint.proxyHost.description: To define a proxy host when instantiating the SQS client

camel.source.endpoint.proxyPort.name: camel.source.endpoint.proxyPort
camel.source.endpoint.proxyPort.description: To define a proxy port when instantiating the SQS client

camel.source.endpoint.maximumMessageSize.name: camel.source.endpoint.maximumMessageSize
camel.source.endpoint.maximumMessageSize.description: The maximumMessageSize (in bytes) an SQS message can contain for this queue.

camel.source.endpoint.messageRetentionPe.name: camel.source.endpoint.messageRetentionPeriod
camel.source.endpoint.messageRetentionPe.description: The messageRetentionPeriod (in seconds) a message will be retained by SQS for this queue.

camel.source.endpoint.policy.name: camel.source.endpoint.policy
camel.source.endpoint.policy.description: The policy for this queue. It can be loaded by default from classpath, but you can prefix with classpath:, file:, or http: to load the resource from different systems.

camel.source.endpoint.receiveMessageWait.name: camel.source.endpoint.receiveMessageWaitTimeSeconds
camel.source.endpoint.receiveMessageWait.description: If you do not specify WaitTimeSeconds in the request, the queue attribute ReceiveMessageWaitTimeSeconds is used to determine how long to wait.

camel.source.endpoint.redrivePolicy.name: camel.source.endpoint.redrivePolicy
camel.source.endpoint.redrivePolicy.description: Specify the policy that send message to DeadLetter queue. See detail at Amazon docs.

camel.source.endpoint.backoffErrorThresh.name: camel.source.endpoint.backoffErrorThreshold
camel.source.endpoint.backoffErrorThresh.description: The number of subsequent error polls (failed due some error) that should happen before the backoffMultipler should kick-in.

camel.source.endpoint.backoffIdleThresho.name: camel.source.endpoint.backoffIdleThreshold
camel.source.endpoint.backoffIdleThresho.description: The number of subsequent idle polls that should happen before the backoffMultipler should kick-in.

camel.source.endpoint.backoffMultiplier.name: camel.source.endpoint.backoffMultiplier
camel.source.endpoint.backoffMultiplier.description: To let the scheduled polling consumer backoff if there has been a number of subsequent idles/errors in a row. The multiplier is then the number of polls that will be skipped before the next actual attempt is happening again. When this option is in use then backoffIdleThreshold and/or backoffErrorThreshold must also be configured.

camel.source.endpoint.greedy.name: camel.source.endpoint.greedy
camel.source.endpoint.greedy.description: If greedy is enabled, then the ScheduledPollConsumer will run immediately again, if the previous run polled 1 or more messages.

camel.source.endpoint.initialDelay.name: camel.source.endpoint.initialDelay
camel.source.endpoint.initialDelay.description: Milliseconds before the first poll starts.

camel.source.endpoint.repeatCount.name: camel.source.endpoint.repeatCount
camel.source.endpoint.repeatCount.description: Specifies a maximum limit of number of fires. So if you set it to 1, the scheduler will only fire once. If you set it to 5, it will only fire five times. A value of zero or negative means fire forever.

camel.source.endpoint.runLoggingLevel.name: camel.source.endpoint.runLoggingLevel
camel.source.endpoint.runLoggingLevel.description: The consumer logs a start/complete log line when it polls. This option allows you to configure the logging level for that. One of: [TRACE] [DEBUG] [INFO] [WARN] [ERROR] [OFF]

camel.source.endpoint.scheduledExecutorS.name: camel.source.endpoint.scheduledExecutorService
camel.source.endpoint.scheduledExecutorS.description: Allows for configuring a custom/shared thread pool to use for the consumer. By default each consumer has its own single threaded thread pool.

camel.source.endpoint.scheduler.name: camel.source.endpoint.scheduler
camel.source.endpoint.scheduler.description: To use a cron scheduler from either camel-spring or camel-quartz component. Use value spring or quartz for built in scheduler

camel.source.endpoint.schedulerPropertie.name: camel.source.endpoint.schedulerProperties
camel.source.endpoint.schedulerPropertie.description: To configure additional properties when using a custom scheduler or any of the Quartz, Spring based scheduler.

camel.source.endpoint.startScheduler.name: camel.source.endpoint.startScheduler
camel.source.endpoint.startScheduler.description: Whether the scheduler should be auto started.

camel.source.endpoint.timeUnit.name: camel.source.endpoint.timeUnit
camel.source.endpoint.timeUnit.description: Time unit for initialDelay and delay options. One of: [NANOSECONDS] [MICROSECONDS] [MILLISECONDS] [SECONDS] [MINUTES] [HOURS] [DAYS]

camel.source.endpoint.useFixedDelay.name: camel.source.endpoint.useFixedDelay
camel.source.endpoint.useFixedDelay.description: Controls if fixed delay or fixed rate is used. See ScheduledExecutorService in JDK for details.

camel.component.aws2-sqs.amazonAWSHost.name: camel.component.aws2-sqs.amazonAWSHost
camel.component.aws2-sqs.amazonAWSHost.description: The hostname of the Amazon AWS cloud.

camel.component.aws2-sqs.amazonSQSClient.name: camel.component.aws2-sqs.amazonSQSClient
camel.component.aws2-sqs.amazonSQSClient.description: To use the AmazonSQS as client

camel.component.aws2-sqs.autoCreateQueue.name: camel.component.aws2-sqs.autoCreateQueue
camel.component.aws2-sqs.autoCreateQueue.description: Setting the autocreation of the queue

camel.component.aws2-sqs.overrideEndpoin.name: camel.component.aws2-sqs.overrideEndpoint
camel.component.aws2-sqs.overrideEndpoin.description: Set the need for overidding the endpoint. This option needs to be used in combination with uriEndpointOverride option

camel.component.aws2-sqs.protocol.name: camel.component.aws2-sqs.protocol
camel.component.aws2-sqs.protocol.description: The underlying protocol used to communicate with SQS

camel.component.aws2-sqs.proxyProtocol.name: camel.component.aws2-sqs.proxyProtocol
camel.component.aws2-sqs.proxyProtocol.description: To define a proxy protocol when instantiating the SQS client One of: [HTTP] [HTTPS]

camel.component.aws2-sqs.queueOwnerAWSAc.name: camel.component.aws2-sqs.queueOwnerAWSAccountId
camel.component.aws2-sqs.queueOwnerAWSAc.description: Specify the queue owner aws account id when you need to connect the queue with different account owner.

camel.component.aws2-sqs.region.name: camel.component.aws2-sqs.region
camel.component.aws2-sqs.region.description: The region in which SQS client needs to work. When using this parameter, the configuration will expect the lowercase name of the region (for example ap-east-1) You'll need to use the name Region.EU_WEST_1.id()

camel.component.aws2-sqs.trustAllCertifi.name: camel.component.aws2-sqs.trustAllCertificates
camel.component.aws2-sqs.trustAllCertifi.description: If we want to trust all certificates in case of overriding the endpoint

camel.component.aws2-sqs.uriEndpointOver.name: camel.component.aws2-sqs.uriEndpointOverride
camel.component.aws2-sqs.uriEndpointOver.description: Set the overriding uri endpoint. This option needs to be used in combination with overrideEndpoint option

camel.component.aws2-sqs.useDefaultCrede.name: camel.component.aws2-sqs.useDefaultCredentialsProvider
camel.component.aws2-sqs.useDefaultCrede.description: Set whether the SQS client should expect to load credentials on an AWS infra instance or to expect static credentials to be passed in.

camel.component.aws2-sqs.attributeNames.name: camel.component.aws2-sqs.attributeNames
camel.component.aws2-sqs.attributeNames.description: A list of attribute names to receive when consuming. Multiple names can be separated by comma.

camel.component.aws2-sqs.bridgeErrorHand.name: camel.component.aws2-sqs.bridgeErrorHandler
camel.component.aws2-sqs.bridgeErrorHand.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.component.aws2-sqs.concurrentConsu.name: camel.component.aws2-sqs.concurrentConsumers
camel.component.aws2-sqs.concurrentConsu.description: Allows you to use multiple threads to poll the sqs queue to increase throughput

camel.component.aws2-sqs.deleteAfterRead.name: camel.component.aws2-sqs.deleteAfterRead
camel.component.aws2-sqs.deleteAfterRead.description: Delete message from SQS after it has been read

camel.component.aws2-sqs.deleteIfFiltere.name: camel.component.aws2-sqs.deleteIfFiltered
camel.component.aws2-sqs.deleteIfFiltere.description: Whether or not to send the DeleteMessage to the SQS queue if the exchange has property with key Sqs2Constants#SQS_DELETE_FILTERED (CamelAwsSqsDeleteFiltered) set to true.

camel.component.aws2-sqs.extendMessageVi.name: camel.component.aws2-sqs.extendMessageVisibility
camel.component.aws2-sqs.extendMessageVi.description: If enabled then a scheduled background task will keep extending the message visibility on SQS. This is needed if it takes a long time to process the message. If set to true defaultVisibilityTimeout must be set. See details at Amazon docs.

camel.component.aws2-sqs.kmsDataKeyReuse.name: camel.component.aws2-sqs.kmsDataKeyReusePeriodSeconds
camel.component.aws2-sqs.kmsDataKeyReuse.description: The length of time, in seconds, for which Amazon SQS can reuse a data key to encrypt or decrypt messages before calling AWS KMS again. An integer representing seconds, between 60 seconds (1 minute) and 86,400 seconds (24 hours). Default: 300 (5 minutes).

camel.component.aws2-sqs.kmsMasterKeyId.name: camel.component.aws2-sqs.kmsMasterKeyId
camel.component.aws2-sqs.kmsMasterKeyId.description: The ID of an AWS-managed customer master key (CMK) for Amazon SQS or a custom CMK.

camel.component.aws2-sqs.messageAttribut.name: camel.component.aws2-sqs.messageAttributeNames
camel.component.aws2-sqs.messageAttribut.description: A list of message attribute names to receive when consuming. Multiple names can be separated by comma.

camel.component.aws2-sqs.serverSideEncry.name: camel.component.aws2-sqs.serverSideEncryptionEnabled
camel.component.aws2-sqs.serverSideEncry.description: Define if Server Side Encryption is enabled or not on the queue

camel.component.aws2-sqs.visibilityTimeo.name: camel.component.aws2-sqs.visibilityTimeout
camel.component.aws2-sqs.visibilityTimeo.description: The duration (in seconds) that the received messages are hidden from subsequent retrieve requests after being retrieved by a ReceiveMessage request to set in the com.amazonaws.services.sqs.model.SetQueueAttributesRequest. This only make sense if its different from defaultVisibilityTimeout. It changes the queue visibility timeout attribute permanently.

camel.component.aws2-sqs.waitTimeSeconds.name: camel.component.aws2-sqs.waitTimeSeconds
camel.component.aws2-sqs.waitTimeSeconds.description: Duration in seconds (0 to 20) that the ReceiveMessage action call will wait until a message is in the queue to include in the response.

camel.component.aws2-sqs.autowiredEnable.name: camel.component.aws2-sqs.autowiredEnabled
camel.component.aws2-sqs.autowiredEnable.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.

camel.component.aws2-sqs.delayQueue.name: camel.component.aws2-sqs.delayQueue
camel.component.aws2-sqs.delayQueue.description: Define if you want to apply delaySeconds option to the queue or on single messages

camel.component.aws2-sqs.queueUrl.name: camel.component.aws2-sqs.queueUrl
camel.component.aws2-sqs.queueUrl.description: To define the queueUrl explicitly. All other parameters, which would influence the queueUrl, are ignored. This parameter is intended to be used, to connect to a mock implementation of SQS, for testing purposes.

camel.component.aws2-sqs.proxyHost.name: camel.component.aws2-sqs.proxyHost
camel.component.aws2-sqs.proxyHost.description: To define a proxy host when instantiating the SQS client

camel.component.aws2-sqs.proxyPort.name: camel.component.aws2-sqs.proxyPort
camel.component.aws2-sqs.proxyPort.description: To define a proxy port when instantiating the SQS client

camel.component.aws2-sqs.maximumMessageS.name: camel.component.aws2-sqs.maximumMessageSize
camel.component.aws2-sqs.maximumMessageS.description: The maximumMessageSize (in bytes) an SQS message can contain for this queue.

camel.component.aws2-sqs.messageRetentio.name: camel.component.aws2-sqs.messageRetentionPeriod
camel.component.aws2-sqs.messageRetentio.description: The messageRetentionPeriod (in seconds) a message will be retained by SQS for this queue.

camel.component.aws2-sqs.policy.name: camel.component.aws2-sqs.policy
camel.component.aws2-sqs.policy.description: The policy for this queue. It can be loaded by default from classpath, but you can prefix with classpath:, file:, or http: to load the resource from different systems.

camel.component.aws2-sqs.receiveMessageW.name: camel.component.aws2-sqs.receiveMessageWaitTimeSeconds
camel.component.aws2-sqs.receiveMessageW.description: If you do not specify WaitTimeSeconds in the request, the queue attribute ReceiveMessageWaitTimeSeconds is used to determine how long to wait.

camel.component.aws2-sqs.redrivePolicy.name: camel.component.aws2-sqs.redrivePolicy
camel.component.aws2-sqs.redrivePolicy.description: Specify the policy that send message to DeadLetter queue. See detail at Amazon docs.
